1.title: Lawnmowing
1.author: [No author]
1.series: Aug. 28, 1942) "We Can't Mow The Lawn, Unca Donald, The Mower Broke!"*
notes: Summary: The boys broke the lawnmower with a sledghammer; Donald watches them from his hammock while they cut it with scissors.

2.title: Lawnmowing
2.author: by Clark.
2.series: June 20, 1944) "I Felt so Sorry For Him I Mowed the Lawn Myself!"*
notes: Summary: The boy he hired seemed too young.

3.title: Lawnmowing
3.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Carlyle's making money cutting lawns for neighbors, and Pop wants to join him.

4.title: Lawnmowing
4.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Waldo was going to hire Carlyle to cut the lawn, until he heard the estimate.

5.title: Lawnmowing
5.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Pop complains about feeling cooped up and Hazel sends him out to mow the lawn.

6.title: Lawnmowing
6.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Waldo mops the floor, mows the lawn, and trims the hedge, and is told how lucky he is not to have to work on Saturdays.

7.title: Lawnmowing
7.author: Bill Berry
7.appears_in: p. 35 in Treasure Chest of Fun and Fact, v. 4, no. 9 (Dec. 28, 1948).
notes: Silent strip.

8.title: Lawnmowing
8.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Carlyle wants to work hard and be an Eagle Scout, and Pop with the push mower suggests he could start by clipping the edges of the lawn.

9.title: Lawnmowing
9.author: Dudley Fisher.
9.series: June 1, 1950) "By the Time Eddie Gets Over the Measles the Darn Grass will Need Cutting Again!"*
notes: Summary: Samson's mad. He mowed the lawn to get permission to go to Eddie's party, then Eddie got sick.

10.title: Lawnmowing
10.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Carlyle's mowing the lawn to earn a baseball mitt; Mr. Botts says he invested his money when he was a kid in horse racing.

11.title: Lawnmowing
11.author: by Al Vermeer.
notes: Summary: Carlyle's mowing the lawn without being asked, but it turns out it's only until he finds the missing baseball. Priscilla is wearing a catcher's mitt and has a bird cage on her head.

12.title: Lawnmowing
12.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Reggie and Archie compete to see who can mow more lawns to raise money for Saturday night dates.

13.title: Lawnmowing
13.author: [No author]
13.series: Sept. 2, 1951?) "Don't Hurry on Account of Us, Elt"*
notes: (Heroes are Made, Not Born)
Summary: It'll take him a hour and a half to mow the lawn, but his friends will wait.

14.title: Lawnmowing
14.author: Hanan.
notes: Summary: A little boy cries to get Louie to let him push the lawnmower, and a woman swats Louie with her umbrella for making the boy mow the lawn.
Wordless strip.

15.title: Lawnmowing
15.author: [No author]
notes: Wilbur is mowing the lawn, but gets distracted by girls walking by. His father puts a set of blinders on him.

16.title: Lawnmowing
16.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Dad wants to go golfing, but Mom makes him mow the lawn.

17.title: Lawnmowing
17.author: [No author]
notes: A gag about lawnmowing.

18.title: Lawnmowing
18.author: [No author]
notes: Begins: "Con lo que te he dicho supongo que no te negar√°s ahora a cortar el pasto!"
Lawnmowing gag.

19.title: Lawnmowing
19.author: Henry Boltinoff, script and art ; Gaspar Saladino, letters
19.series: Feb. 1959) "Mowing the Lawn, Great Way to Meet Girls"*
notes: Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

20.title: Lawnmowing
20.author: Skip Williamson
20.appears_in: reprinted on p. 17 in The World of Comic Art, v. 1, no. 1 (June 1966).
notes: Summary: The grim reaper comes to the door with his scythe offering to mow the lawn.

21.title: Lawnmowing
21.author: Walt Wetterberg.
notes: Summary: It's hard to mow the lawn when a sleeping cat won't move for the lawnmower.

22.title: Lawnmowing
22.author: Gill Fox.
22.series: Aug. 15, 1967) "If the Golf Course has Non-Allergy Grass, How Come We Can't Have It?"
notes: Setting: She's mowing the lawn, and he's loading his golf clubs in the trunk of the car.

23.title: Lawnmowing
23.author: Mik.
notes: Summary: Ferd'nand is shoveling snow when the sun comes out, and he is pleased until he thinks of lawnmowing.

24.title: Lawnmowing
24.author: by George Clark.
24.series: July 20, 1970) "That's Right, Just Lift Your Feet Like You Do When I'm Sweeping the Rug"
notes: Summary: She's using a push mower; he's in a lawn chair.

25.title: Lawnmowing
25.author: by Dick Turner.
25.series: Apr. 26, 1972) "Why Don't You Take a Break, Dear, and Go Weed My Petunias?"
notes: Setting: He's mowing the lawn and not enjoying it.

26.title: Lawnmowing
26.author: [No author]
notes: Begins: What are you doing, Lana? What does it.

27.title: Lawnmowing
27.author: by Gilbert Shelton.
27.series: 1980) "I Wish Fat Freddy Would Mow This Back Yard!"*

28.title: Lawnmowing
28.author: by Ted Richards (San Francisco, CA : Last Gasp, 1981).
notes: About lawnmowing.

29.title: Lawnmowing
29.author: Marlette.
29.series: Nov. 30, 1982) "There's a Lot to Learn from Watchin' Somebody Mow a Lawn!"*
notes: Summary: Kudzu asks Uncle Dub to babysit Doris while he mows the lawn; Doris ends up riding on the mower handle.

30.title: Lawnmowing
30.author: Hoest.
30.series: July 2, 1983) "I Find the Best Time to Mow the Lawn is Soon After Loretta Tells Me To"*
notes: Setting: Leroy's talking to a neighbor in the yard.

31.title: Lawnmowing
31.author: Young & Gersher.
31.series: Sept. 1, 1983) "I'll Pay You Two Bucks to Forget the Whole Thing"*
notes: For a dollar, Blondie wants Alexander to mow the lawn, take out the garbage, clean the garage, etc., and Alexander has a counter-offer.

32.title: Lawnmowing
32.author: Hoest.
32.series: June 15, 1984) "Over Your Dead Body Could Be Arranged"
notes: Summary: Leroy is in his lawn chair, and Loretta confronts him with the lawnmower.

33.title: Lawnmowing
33.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
33.series: June 27, 1984) "Dad! Mom's Coming Out to Help You with the Grass"*
notes: Summary: Lois tells Chip she's not going to play monopoly because Hi needs help with the lawnmowing.

34.title: Lawnmowing
34.author: MacNelly.
34.series: July 21, 1984) "Allergic to Various Grasses and Pollens and Work in All its Hideous Forms"*
notes: SUMMARY: Skyler has to mow the lawn because of Cosmo's wheezing.

35.title: Lawnmowing
35.author: by R
notes: Summary: Gaylord reminds Broom-Hilda of her promise to cut the grass, so she plucks one blade.

36.title: Lawnmowing
36.author: Hoest.
36.series: June 10, 1985) "Mowing the Lawn Might Make You Feel Better"
notes: Summary: Loretta offers advice to a bedraggled Leroy in his pajamas.

37.title: Lawnmowing
37.author: MacNelly.
37.series: July 17, 1985) "I Happen to Have a Very Bad Allergy"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo's allergy to perspiration prevents him from mowing his lawn.

38.title: Lawnmowing
38.author: Mort Walker.
38.series: Aug. 20, 1985) "There's Trouble on Guard Post Number Four"*
notes: Summary: Zero is trying to stop the lawnmowing because of a "keep off the grass" sign.

39.title: Lawnmowing
39.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
39.series: Sept. 5, 1985) "Hey, Monica! I Thought You Were Going to Walk With Me"*
notes: Summary: Monica said she'd like to take a walk, but didn't know it meant following Chip around as he mowed the lawn.

40.title: Lawnmowing
40.author: Smythe.
40.series: Sept. 7, 1985) "Wonder Woman Comes On in a Minute"*
notes: Summary: Andy complains about all the kids' programs on the telly, and Flo suggests he mow the lawn instead.

41.title: Lawnmowing
41.author: Armstrong.
41.series: Mar. 22, 1986) "He's Estimating How Many More Saturdays He's Got Off Before He Has To Start Mowing The Lawn Again"*
notes: Summary: Marvin and a bird sit in the sandbox watching Marvin's dad inspect the lawn.

42.title: Lawnmowing
42.author: [No author]
42.series: May 24, 1986) "Dad Gets Tired of Mowing the Lawn, Too, and He's Newer than You Are"
notes: Situation: Dennis is talking to Mr. Wilson.

43.title: Lawnmowing
43.author: Millar-Hinds.
43.series: June 10, 1986) "He's Been Mowing Both our Neighbors' Yards for Three Years and Hasn't Realized It Yet"*
notes: Summary: Shopping for a Father's Day gift; it seems he already has a television set attached to his lawnmower.

44.title: Lawnmowing
44.author: Unger.
44.series: July 26, 1986) "I Thought You Were Going to Mow the Lawn"
notes: Summary: He's sitting with his foot in a shredded shoe.

45.title: Lawnmowing
45.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: From his hammock, Lord P. fights air pollution by not mowing the lawn, and Lady P. ends up mowing it.

46.title: Lawnmowing
46.author: Gary Wise and Lance Aldrich.
46.series: July 2, 1992) "You fertilize your grass so it will grow, then you cut it so it won't be so high, then you swear at it because it grows so fast"

47.title: Lawnmowing
47.author: Dik Browne.
47.series: July 27, 1987) "He Cut One Row and Gave Up"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty hired a boy to cut his grass, but it didn't work out.

48.title: Lawnmowing
48.author: Bittle.
notes: Summary: When asked to mow the lawn, Artie tries to avoid it on theoretical grounds.

49.title: Lawnmowing
49.author: Young & Drake.
49.series: Aug. 29, 1987) "Did He Plan It Like This?"*
notes: Summary: Blondie tells Dagwood it's too hot to mow the lawn, sits him in the shade and brings him lemonade.

50.title: Lawnmowing
50.author: by Amerongen.
50.series: Oct. 17, 1987) "Are You the Guy Who's Been Running that Loud, Stinky Mower All Evening?"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Carlisle is boinking Smitty on the head for his lawnmowing.

51.title: Lawnmowing
51.author: by Anderson.
51.series: June 8, 1988) "That's a Real Team, and Headed Right for the Old Oak Tree"
notes: Summary: Marmaduke and his master are mowing the lawn and watching a woman in a strapless dress walk her dog.

52.title: Lawnmowing
52.author: by Jimmy Johnson.
notes: Summary: Arlo tries to avoid mowing the lawn by saying that tall grass is a good wildlife habitat.

53.title: Lawnmowing
53.author: by Hoest.
53.series: July 27, 1988) "I Have a Lawn Problem Too. I Can't Get Leroy to Mow It"

54.title: Lawnmowing
54.author: Smythe.
notes: Summary: Flo says she's tired of staying in, and then ends up mowing the lawn.

55.title: Lawnmowing
55.author: Smythe.
55.series: Oct. 21, 1988) "And A Mate Who's Twit Enough To Do It For Him"*
notes: Summary: Behind every successful man there's a wife telling him what to do, says Flo, and it looks like Chalkie's going to mow their lawn.

56.title: Lawnmowing
56.author: Lynn.
56.series: Aug. 15, 1989) "Maybe You Should Mow One of the Lawns First"*
notes: Summary: It's hot out and Michael needs to have a drink and cool off.

57.title: Lawnmowing
57.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Michael is mowing grumpily until a girl jogger comes by and he straightens up and smiles.
Wordless strip.

58.title: Lawnmowing
58.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Alexander offers to cut the lawn, but there are eight inches of snow on the ground.

59.title: Lawnmowing
59.author: Bittle.
59.series: June 9, 1990) "What Have You Got That Will Turn My Lawn Lush, Green and Beautiful Without Me Having to Mow, Edge or Weed It?"*
notes: Summary: Artie visits a nursery.

60.title: Lawnmowing
60.author: by Greg Evans.
60.series: June 23, 1990) "You Mowed It Twice Yesterday When Diane Was Out There, Remember?"*
notes: Summary: Brad mows the lawn when his binoculars say it's time.

61.title: Lawnmowing
61.author: Browne.
61.series: July 21, 1990) "I Can't Use the Weather as an Excuse Not to Mow the Lawn This Morning"*
notes: Summary: Hi's mowing the lawn in the rain, so he can play golf later.

62.title: Lawnmowing
62.author: Hoest & Reiner.
62.series: July 5, 1991) "It's Okay, Loretta, I Gave Her $5"
notes: Summary: Leroy has Agatha Crumm mowing his lawn.

63.title: Lawnmowing
63.author: Hank Ketcham.
63.series: Oct. 6, 1991) "If I Have to Wait Seven More Years to Get a Lawnmowing Job, Everybody's Lawn Will be Mowed!"

64.title: Lawnmowing
64.author: Johnson.
64.series: Apr. 14, 1992) "Ok, Ok! So Hire Someone to Mow the Lawn!"*
notes: Summary: Arlo asserts his duty to stimulate the economy.

65.title: Lawnmowing
65.author: Walker & Chance Browne.
65.series: May 2, 1992) "Is That the Grass I Hear Growing?"*
notes: Summary: Lois interrupts a peaceful Spring day with a hint about mowing the lawn.

66.title: Lawnmowing
66.author: Joe Martin.
notes: Summary: Willy says he gets his exercise mowing the lawn.

67.title: Lawnmowing
67.author: by Mort Walker.
67.series: Sept. 8, 1992) "What Doth It Profit a Man?"*
notes: Summary: Beetle inquires about the job mowing the chapel lawn.

68.title: Lawnmowing
68.author: Smythe.
68.series: Nov. 24, 1992) "You Can Take a Lot of the Sweat out of Gardening if you go about it the Right Way"*
notes: Summary: Andy tricks Flo into mowing the grass by reporting what the neighbors are saying.

69.title: Lawnmowing
69.author: by Jimmy Johnson.
69.series: May 9, 1993) "Let Me Get This Right: If Not For Mowing the Lawn, You'd Be Exploring New Worlds?"

70.title: Lawnmowing
70.author: Ketcham.
70.series: May 25, 1993) "Why Don't You Plant Shorter Grass?"*
notes: Summary: Dennis has advice for Mr. Wilson about lawnmowing.

71.title: Lawnmowing
71.author: by Greg Evans.
71.series: Aug. 11, 1993) "How Long Will It Take You To Start The Mower?"*
notes: Summary: Brad says it will take him only 15 minutes to mow the lawn.

72.title: Lawnmowing
72.author: Bittle.
72.series: June 5, 1993) "About Time You Mowed the Lawn?"*
notes: Summary: It's June, and Artie's still on the couch.

73.title: Lawnmowing
73.author: by Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: Michael mows a single swath and leaves the lawnmower.

74.title: Lawnmowing
74.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Jon has disturbed Garfield's sleep with his lawnmowing.

75.title: Lawnmowing
75.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
75.series: Aug. 23, 1993) "It Means That You're Not the One who is Out There Mowing It"*
notes: Summary: Crankshaft enjoys the smell of newmown grass coming through the window.

76.title: Lawnmowing
76.author: Wilson.
76.series: Dec. 1, 1993) "Go Mow the Lawn While You're Waiting"*
notes: Summary: Ziggy visits Mom's Diner, and dinner isn't ready.

77.title: Lawnmowing
77.author: Chance Browne.
77.series: Apr. 23, 1994) "But I'll Hate It After I Cut the Lawn Another 20 Times"*
notes: Summary: It's Spring, and Hi agrees that the newly cut grass smells nice.

78.title: Lawnmowing
78.author: by Dean Young and Stan Drake.
78.series: June 25, 1994) "Once He Starts a Thing He Keeps On Doing It"*
notes: Summary: Blondie interrupts Dagwood's lawnmowing for some lemonade, and he never gets back to the lawn.

79.title: Lawnmowing
79.author: Hoest & Reiner.
79.series: July 1, 1994) "Leroy Will Have to Mow the Lawn Now. He Can't Find His Hammock"

80.title: Lawnmowing
80.author: Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: The grass is so tall you can't see out the front window.

81.title: Lawnmowing
81.author: Bittle.
81.series: June 9, 1995) "About Time You Mowed the Lawn?"*
notes: Summary: Artie is reminded that it's June already.

82.title: Lawnmowing
82.author: Young & Drake.
82.series: Aug. 26, 1995) "If I Lie Down In My Hammock, She'll Find Some Work For Me"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood starts mowing the lawn when it's too hot out, and Blondie makes him quit and lie in his hammock.

83.title: Lawnmowing
83.author: Robert Gill.
83.series: Sept. 2, 1995) "You Know How My Dad Hates to Cut the Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Dad's getting artificial turf.

84.title: Lawnmowing
84.author: Jim Davis.
notes: Garfield is sleeping in a patch of tall grass in the middle of an otherwise mown lawn.

85.title: Lawnmowing
85.author: by Hoest & Reiner.
85.series: July 13, 1996) "How About Mowing Our Lawn, Leroy?"
notes: Summary: Leroy is using his push mower in a sunbathing neighbor's yard.

86.title: Lawnmowing
86.author: Young & Drake.
86.series: Aug. 24, 1996) "Oh Well, It's the Thought That Counts"*
notes: Summary: Alexander thinks about surprising Dad by mowing the lawn, but then meets Lisa at the Burger Den instead.

87.title: Lawnmowing
87.author: Jim Davis.
87.series: Apr. 4, 1997) "All Right, All Right! I'll Mow the Lawn!"*
notes: Summary: Odie and Garfield suit up for a safari to go out and get the newspaper.

88.title: Lawnmowing
88.author: by Joe Martin.
88.series: May 13, 1997) "Caught Keeping Two Sets of 'To-Do' Lists"*
notes: Summary: One list has "mow lawn" on it, the other has "golf."

89.title: Lawnmowing
89.author: by Mike Peters.
notes: Summary: Mr. Flamingo is mowing his lawn. His lawn ornaments are plastic humans in bow ties, each holding up one leg.

90.title: Lawnmowing
90.author: Chris Browne.
90.series: July 23, 1997) "Oh, It's a Recurring Thing. It Happens Every Time the Grass Needs Cutting"*
notes: Summary: Hagar is groaning and can't move, and Honi asks Helga what's wrong with Dad.

91.title: Lawnmowing
91.author: Chance Browne.
91.series: Aug. 22, 1997) "I Decided to Go Around and Around for a Change"*
notes: Summary: Chip is mowing the lawn in a circular pattern.

92.title: Lawnmowing
92.author: Chance Browne.
92.series: June 6, 1998) "Sorry, We Gotta Charge Extra to Move Your Husband"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty is sleeping in his chaise lounge, so the lawn service didn't mow that spot.

93.title: Lawnmowing
93.author: Gilbert.
93.series: June 19, 1998) "At Least My Lawn Mower Loves Me"*
notes: Summary: Paul tries for some quality time with Buckles, but Buckles keeps hiding so Paul mows the lawn.

94.title: Lawnmowing
94.author: Gilbert.
94.series: Aug. 3, 1998) "I Think It's Time to Mow the Lawn, Paul"*
notes: Summary: Buckles is playing hyena. He steals hamburgers from the picnic table of the lions, and disappears into the tall grass of the African plains.

95.title: Lawnmowing
95.author: M
95.series: Mar. 20, 1999) "A Little Exercise would do you a World of Good, Bruno"*
notes: Summary: Fergus is mowing the lawn with a push mower, and finds Bruno grown over with grass and flowers.

96.title: Lawnmowing
96.author: M
notes: Summary: The lawn is growing so fast that he has to mow non-stop.

97.title: Lawnmowing
97.author: by Wise & Aldrich.
notes: Summary: A man mowing his lawn and a man walking his dog greet each other in spite of their real feelings.

98.title: Lawnmowing
98.author: Bell-Lundy.
98.series: July 9, 1999) "Do You Want the Basic Lawn Care Maintenance Package or the Deluxe Landscaping Option?"*
notes: Summary: The young entrepreneur at the door charges extra to weed-whack the edges.

99.title: Lawnmowing
99.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
99.series: July 9, 1999) "Look at the Bright Side. We Won't Have to Mow It for a While!"*
notes: Summary: The grass fire has destroyed two lawns and the fence between.

100.title: Lawnmowing
100.author: Johnson.
notes: Summary: Gene is mowing the lawn, Arlo says a little heat won't kill him.

101.title: Lawnmowing
101.author: Aaron McGruder.
101.series: July 19, 1999) "Good Talk, Granddad. Have Fun with the Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Granddad tries to suggest that Huey should mow the lawn.
Strip re-distributed for May 28, 2001.

102.title: Lawnmowing
102.author: Aaron McGruder.
102.series: July 20, 1999) "Isn't That Why We Pay Property Tax?"*
notes: Summary: Huey thinks the state should cut the lawn.

103.title: Lawnmowing
103.author: Brookins.
103.series: July 21, 1999) "A Plugger Putting on the Green"
notes: Summary: Mowing the lawn with a riding lawnmower (putt-putt).

104.title: Lawnmowing
104.author: Aaron McGruder.
104.series: July 21, 1999) "A Printout of Child Labor Laws?"*
notes: Summary: Huey is asked to mow the lawn and responds in his own way.
Redistributed for May 30, 2001.

105.title: Lawnmowing
105.author: Aaron McGruder.
105.series: July 22, 1999) "So Is It Swing Low, Sweet Chariot?"*
notes: Summary: Huey's going to mow the lawn, and asks Granddad about appropriate slave songs to sing.

106.title: Lawnmowing
106.author: Aaron McGruder.
106.series: July 24, 1999) "Shut Up and Mow the Lawn, Boy! And Who's Garry Trudeau?"*
notes: Summary: Nike was in trouble with Garry Trudeau for working conditions like this.

107.title: Lawnmowing
107.author: Aaron McGruder.
107.series: July 27, 1999) "In a Few Days, We Gotta Do It All Over Again!"*
notes: Summary: Huey explains lawnmowing as pushing the deathtrap through the heat and insects, and then gets to the really sick part.

108.title: Lawnmowing
108.author: Aaron McGruder.
108.series: July 28, 1999) "Instead of Cutting the Grass Every Week, Let's Just Burn It!"*

109.title: Lawnmowing
109.author: Aaron McGruder.
109.series: July 31, 1999) "We've Turned It Into Something Mundane"*
notes: Summary: Huey says mowing the lawn was terrible, like cutting his hair would be.

110.title: Lawnmowing
110.author: by Dean Young and Denis Lebrun.
110.series: Aug. 3, 1999) "After Our Wedding, Courtney and I are Going to Move In With You and Mom, and in Return, I'll Cut the Grass"*
notes: Summary: Alexander contemplates property taxes, medical insurance, and homeowner's insurance.

111.title: Lawnmowing
111.author: Chance Browne.
111.series: Aug. 4, 1999) "The Only Thing More Boring than Mowing is Watching Someone Mowing!"
notes: Summary: Trixie watches Hi push the lawnmower back and forth.

112.title: Lawnmowing
112.author: Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Garfield supervises Jon's mowing of the lawn.

113.title: Lawnmowing
113.author: B
113.series: Aug. 9, 1999) "Did You Put Any Fertilizer on the Lawn This Year?"*
notes: Summary: The result would be needing to mow it more often, so the answer is no.

114.title: Lawnmowing
114.author: Hoest & Reiner.
114.series: Aug. 12, 1999) "You're So Far Behind There's 'Mow the Lawn' and 'Shovel the Driveway' on Here"
notes: Summary: Loretta looks over Leroy's job list.

115.title: Lawnmowing
115.author: Brookins.
115.series: Aug. 24, 1999) "Pluggers Spend More Time Cranking than Mowing"
notes: Summary: A plugger is trying to start his lawnmower.

116.title: Lawnmowing
116.author: Kelso & Kemp.
116.series: Sept. 1, 1999) "Weekend Chore is Accomplished with Ease"
notes: Summary: A man watches a younger man mow the lawn.

117.title: Lawnmowing
117.author: by Dave Coverly.
notes: Summary: A team of sled dogs is pulling a lawnmower.

118.title: Lawnmowing
118.author: by John McPherson.
118.series: June 20, 2000) "Thanks to Their New Personal Body Screens, the Dempsters Enjoyed a Bug-Free Summer"
notes: Summary: Mr. Dempster is mowing the lawn while enclosed in a cage.

119.title: Lawnmowing
119.author: by Art & Chip Sansom.
119.series: July 3, 2000) "If This Were That Survivor Show, I'd Vote You Off the Island!"*
notes: Summary: Gladys insists that Brutus mow the lawn, no procrastinating.

120.title: Lawnmowing
120.author: Aaron McGruder.
120.series: July 6, 2000) "Didn't I Tell You to Cut the Grass?"*
notes: Summary: Huey turns up with Granddad on his census job, and Granddad is not pleased to see him.

121.title: Lawnmowing
121.author: Hoest & Reiner.
121.series: July 6, 2000) "You Haven't Mowed in a Month"*
notes: Summary: It's a jungle out there.

122.title: Lawnmowing
122.author: Chance Browne.
122.series: July 8, 2000) "It Also Gets Mowed Once In A While!"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty refuses to help in the yard, saying the grass is always greener on the other side of the fence.

123.title: Lawnmowing
123.author: Stantis.
123.series: July 10, 2000) "Gravel! About Five Tons Ought to Cover It"*
notes: Summary: Larry considers an alternative to mowing the lawn.

124.title: Lawnmowing
124.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The grass "sproings" up after each pass of the mower.

125.title: Lawnmowing
125.author: Johnson.
notes: Summary: It starts to rain just as Arlo gets the lawnmower out.

126.title: Lawnmowing
126.author: by Aaron McGruder.
126.series: Aug. 4, 2000) "Did I Mention I May Be Suffering from Clinical Procrastination?"*
notes: Huey gave Riley the census job, then rushed back to mow the lawn like he was supposed to, though he hasn't actually done it yet.

127.title: Lawnmowing
127.author: Bittle.
127.series: Aug. 5, 2000) "I Guess I'd Better Mow the Lawn Before It Starts Raining Again"*
notes: Summary: Artie knows what he should do, but he's still waiting for rain.

128.title: Lawnmowing
128.author: Scott and Borgman.
128.series: Aug. 5, 2000) "Speaking of Garden Rakes, Remember the Lawn Needs Mowing"*
notes: Summary: Jeremy relates to a song about a guy who mutilates himself with a rake.

129.title: Lawnmowing
129.author: Aaron McGruder.
129.series: Aug. 14, 2000) "Darned Shame What He Did To That L'il White Girl"*
notes: Summary: Grandpa doesn't want Riley using the lawnmower, because of something that happened with a weed whacker last Summer.

130.title: Lawnmowing
130.author: Aaron McGruder.
130.series: Aug. 15, 2000) "I Believe It's Wrong to Impose Assimilation on Any Living Thing, Even Grass"*
notes: Summary: Huey explains his political reasons for not mowing the lawn, but Granddad takes off his belt and Huey decides not to continue the explanation.

131.title: Lawnmowing
131.author: by Aaron McGruder.
131.series: Aug. 16, 2000) "I'm Seeing Myself Cut the Grass"*
notes: Summary: Huey tries using positive visualization on the lawn.

132.title: Lawnmowing
132.author: Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: Huey addresses the lawnmowing problem by reading a book on procrastination.

133.title: Lawnmowing
133.author: Aaron McGruder.
133.series: Aug. 18, 2000) "But Don't Think I Won't Do It!"*
notes: Summary: Granddad says if he has to mow the lawn himself he'll have a stroke and die and then he'll have to kill Huey, not necessarily in that order.
Redistributed on July 21, 2006.

134.title: Lawnmowing
134.author: Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: Riley tries to give Huey some moral support with his lawnmowing problem, so they can go see The Klumps.

135.title: Lawnmowing
135.author: A
135.series: Aug. 22, 2000) "That's It! No More Procrastination! I'm Getting Up and Cutting This Grass"*
notes: Summary: Time for focus and discipline.

136.title: Lawnmowing
136.author: Aaron McGruder.
136.series: Aug. 23, 2000) "Would You Like To Play House With Me?"*
notes: Summary: Huey ruminates about reasons not to mow the lawn (he's against "curtailing the progress of nature for aesthetic reasons") but he forgets all that when he gets a worse offer.

137.title: Lawnmowing
137.author: Aaron McGruder.
137.series: Aug. 26, 2000) "But If I Manage to Make Contact with the Underground Railroad, I'm Outta Here"*
notes: Summary: Huey has finally started mowing the lawn.

138.title: Lawnmowing
138.author: Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: Huey has apparently passed out while mowing the lawn. He wakes up and closes his eyes again.

139.title: Lawnmowing
139.author: Aaron McGruder.
139.series: Aug. 29, 2000) "This Yard Has as Much a Right to Grow as My Own Hair!"*
notes: Summary: The lawn is mowed, but Huey feels bad about it.

140.title: Lawnmowing
140.author: Bittle.
140.series: Sept. 9, 2000) "Don't Bother Me While I'm Figuring"*
notes: Summary: Artie is calculating how many more times he'll have to mow the lawn this year, and his wife points out that it needs mowing now.

141.title: Lawnmowing
141.author: Stantis.
141.series: Sept. 23, 2000) "What Did the Lawn Ever Do To Me?"*
notes: Summary: Cutting the grass doesn't seem like an obvious thing to do.

142.title: Lawnmowing
142.author: MBM.
142.series: Oct. 31, 2000) "Hopefully That Should Be the Last Cut of the Year"*
notes: Summary: Fred's master puts the lawnmower in the garden shed one more time.
Wikipedia (8/9/08) suggests this is drawn by Michael Martin.

143.title: Lawnmowing
143.author: Johnson.
143.series: Nov. 10, 2000) "Ding Dong! The Grass is Dead!"*
notes: Summary: Arlo celebrates the end of lawnmowing season.

144.title: Lawnmowing
144.author: by Johnny Hart.
notes: (Wiley's Dictionary)
Summary: About what to do with lawns.

145.title: Lawnmowing
145.author: by Wiley Miller.
145.series: Apr. 20, 2001) "Bert Updates the Bill of Rights"
notes: Summary: Bert grants others the right to mow his lawn.

146.title: Lawnmowing
146.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Helga asks how high the grass will have to be before he cuts it.

147.title: Lawnmowing
147.author: Brookins.
147.series: Apr. 25, 2001) "Pluggers Usually Coordinate the Removal of Their Christmas Lights with the First Lawn Mowing of the Year"

148.title: Lawnmowing
148.author: Breen.
148.series: May 12, 2001) "I Wish I Had His Easy Life"*
notes: Summary: Kate pauses in her lawnmowing to look at Michael sitting under a tree, and Michael looks at the dog, and the dog looks at a squirrel, and the squirrel looks at a bug. All but the bug share the same thought balloon.

149.title: Lawnmowing
149.author: Browne.
149.series: May 12, 2001) "Stop Talking to Squirrels and Start Mowing Our Habitat"*
notes: Summary: Thurston sympathizes with a squirrel who had to leave the Flagstons' yard because Hi is mowing the lawn.

150.title: Lawnmowing
150.author: Jim Davis.
150.series: June 5, 2001) "You're Blinding Me With Your Logic"*
notes: Summary: Jon says it's too nice out to mow the lawn, so he'll water it instead. Garfield puts on sunglasses.

151.title: Lawnmowing
151.author: Wiley.
151.series: June 13, 2001) "How the Energy Crisis Helps Ease the Recession Job Crisis"
notes: Summary: One man pulls a riding lawnmower, while another man rides it holding a whip.

152.title: Lawnmowing
152.author: Marlette.
152.series: June 14, 2001) "Go Out Back and Baptize My Begonias!"*
notes: Summary: Nasal thinks there should be more to discipleship than mowing the preacher's lawn, raking his leaves, trimming his hedges, and washing his car.

153.title: Lawnmowing
153.author: Young & LeBrun.
153.series: July 7, 2001) "Last Weekend You Played Golf in a Downpour"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood's not going to mow the lawn because it's sprinkling out.

154.title: Lawnmowing
154.author: by Hoest & Reiner.
154.series: July 21, 2001) "Leroy Needs All the Encouragement He Can Get"
notes: Summary: Loretta is holding up numerical score cards while Leroy mows the lawn.

155.title: Lawnmowing
155.author: Browne.
155.series: July 27, 2001) "Now He's Going to Wake Up the Whole Neighborhood"*
notes: Summary: Chip finally makes good on his promise to mow the lawn, but it's after dark and he's wearing a light on his forehead.

156.title: Lawnmowing
156.author: Browne.
notes: Summary: Chip mows the lawn but leaves a patch where Trixie left her ball. Hi wants to know why he doesn't just move the ball.

157.title: Lawnmowing
157.author: Bittle.
157.series: Aug. 11, 2001) "Did You Pay Him Enough That He'll Do It Every Weekend?"*
notes: Summary: The neighbor boy was paid to mow the lawn.

158.title: Lawnmowing
158.author: Mark Parisi.
158.series: Oct. 9, 2001) "Wow. How Did You Finally Get Him to Mow the Lawn?"*
notes: Summary: Dad has made an arcade-style game of lawnmowing.

159.title: Lawnmowing
159.author: Gilbert.
159.series: June 10, 2002) "Everyone Needs a Good Contrast in Their Life!"*
notes: Summary: Buckles offers to relax under a tree by way of helping Paul mow the lawn.

160.title: Lawnmowing
160.author: Jim Davis, Brett Koth.
160.series: June 10, 2002) "Mow the Lawn? How About Four Days from Now?"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Potato Head is trying to put it off.

161.title: Lawnmowing
161.author: Jim Davis, Brett Koth.
161.series: June 13, 2002) "I Gave Her My Word Today Was The Day"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Potato Head is talking to his lawn about mowing.

162.title: Lawnmowing
162.author: Jim Davis, Brett Koth.
162.series: June 14, 2002) "Do You Realize You've Avoided Mowing the Lawn for a Whole Week?"*
notes: Summary: A personal best.

163.title: Lawnmowing
163.author: Jim Davis, Brett Koth.
163.series: June 15, 2002) "It Pays to Know Hammocks in High Places"*
notes: Summary: The lawn avoids getting mowed one more time.

164.title: Lawnmowing
164.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
164.series: June 15, 2002) "We Probably Won't Have to Mow The Lawn for a While"*
notes: Summary: The grilling incident has killed the crab grass and trimmed the tree.

165.title: Lawnmowing
165.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
165.series: June 15, 2002) "Well, Look at the Bright Side"*
notes: Summary: The barbecue grill explosion means the crab grass is gone and they won't need to mow the lawn.

166.title: Lawnmowing
166.author: Breen.
notes: Summary: Gabby objects to the sexism of being asked to do housework, and is sent out to mow the lawn.

167.title: Lawnmowing
167.author: Moore.
167.series: July 27, 2002) "I Picked Him Up on eBay"*
notes: Summary: One neighbor is telling another about the football player who is mowing the lawn.

168.title: Lawnmowing
168.author: Breen.
168.series: July 26, 2003) "I'll Do the Other Half Tomorrow"*
notes: Summary: Michael has mowed half the lawn, leaving strips of tall grass.

169.title: Lawnmowing
169.author: Guy & Brad Gilchrist.
169.series: June 3, 2004) "He Offered to Mow Our Lawn Because He Says He Needs the Exercise"*
notes: Summary: Hank from next door is making Sluggo jealous.

170.title: Lawnmowing
170.author: Guy & Brad Gilchrist.
170.series: July 17, 2004) "All the Pretty Girls in the Neighborhood Will Be Coming to Gawk"*
notes: Summary: Hank's mowing the lawn again, and Rollo sets up a lemonade stand for the crowd.

171.title: Lawnmowing
171.author: Young & LeBrun.
171.series: Aug. 14, 2004) "Dagwood, You Promised You Would Cut the Grass if You Got to Play Nine Holes of Golf First"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood feels guilty, but Blondie makes him mow the lawn by moonlight anyhow.

172.title: Lawnmowing
172.author: by Mark Heath.
172.series: Aug. 26, 2004) "The Grim Reaper and His Motorized Scythe are Coming Through!"*
notes: Summary: He calls out a warning to the frogs and toads in the grass.

173.title: Lawnmowing
173.author: Matt Janz.
173.series: Oct. 2, 2004) "I Hope It's Not the Neighbor's Chihuahua"*
notes: Summary: He's mowing the lawn in the dark, and ran over something.

174.title: Lawnmowing
174.author: by Greg Craven & Scott Stantis.
174.series: May 16, 2005) "But All That's Not Enough to Motivate You?"*
notes: Summary: The smell of the grass, the tidiness of the yard, and the sense of accomplishment are all real.

175.title: Lawnmowing
175.author: by Greg Craven & Scott Stantis.
175.series: May 17, 2005) "I Told Dad I Wanted Twenty Dollars to Mow the Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Dad's mowing it himself.

176.title: Lawnmowing
176.author: by Greg Craven & Scott Stantis.
176.series: May 18, 2005) "I'll Be Out Front, in Plain View of Everyone"*
notes: Summary: Dad dresses in shorts, "world's best dad" shirt, straw hat, sandals and sunglasses, and suddenly Toby decides to mow the lawn himself.

177.title: Lawnmowing
177.author: Amend.
177.series: June 14, 2005) "Sweltering Heat, High Humidity, No Breeze, Sun Straight Overhead"*
notes: Summary: Jason tells Peter the weather's right for lawnmowing.

178.title: Lawnmowing
178.author: Amend.
178.series: June 16, 2005) "I'm Giving Voice to the Silent Screams of the Grass"*
notes: Summary: Peter is mowing the lawn and doesn't appreciate Jason's yelling.

179.title: Lawnmowing
179.author: Johnson.
179.series: June 20, 2005) "I Think He's Raising the Wheels"*
notes: Summary: Arlo pays Gene for mowing the lawn, again.

180.title: Lawnmowing
180.author: by Bill Hinds.
180.series: June 28, 2005) "Think of It as Acclimation for Your Soccer Camp"*
notes: Summary: After he mows the lawn, he lays down on the indoor ice rink.

181.title: Lawnmowing
181.author: by Dean Young and Denis LeBrun.
181.series: July 2, 2005) "A Spreadsheet for Budgeting Supplies, Maintenance, Health Insurance, Vacation Time, Expense Account, Cost of Living, Bonuses, and Assorted Expenditures"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood and Elmo are ready to negotiate this year's grass cutting rates.

182.title: Lawnmowing
182.author: by Stephan Pastis.
182.series: July 9, 2005) "Look at That Moron Across the Street"*
notes: Summary: Rat discusses the neighbors and their painting, barking dogs, car alarms, and lawnmowing.

183.title: Lawnmowing
183.author: Brian Basset.
183.series: July 21, 2005) "Thanks for Not Cutting the Grass Short Enough!"*
notes: Summary: Red complains to his brother because his croquet game didn't go well.

184.title: Lawnmowing
184.author: by Brian Walker, Greg Walker & Chance Browne.
184.series: Sept. 3, 2005) "You're Right, Thirsty can Sleep Through Anything!"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty's sleeping in a square of tall grass while Irma mows the lawn.

185.title: Lawnmowing
185.author: Chance Browne.
185.series: May 27, 2006) "Just Finish Mowing the Lawn, Chip"*
notes: Summary: Chip has mowed crop circles into the lawn.

186.title: Lawnmowing
186.author: by Jeff Pickering.
186.series: The Spats, May 31, 2006) "Millions of Women Out There and I Marry an Amateur Dentist"*
notes: Summary: He'd better mow the lawn while he still has teeth.

187.title: Lawnmowing
187.author: Aaron McGruder.
187.series: July 21, 2006) "But Don't Think I Won't Do It!"*
notes: Summary: Granddad says if he has to mow the lawn himself he'll have a stroke and die and then he'll have to kill Huey, not necessarily in that order.
Redistributed on July 21, 2006.

188.title: Lawnmowing
188.author: Brad Anderson.
188.series: Aug. 31, 2006) "Keep in Step, Keep in Step"*
notes: Summary: Marmaduke has his front paws on the shoulders of a man who is mowing a lawn.

189.title: Lawnmowing
189.author: Mort, Greg & Brian Walker.
189.series: Oct. 25, 2006) "I Wish He Wouldn't Make Dates While He's Mowing"*
notes: Summary: Beetle shouts a new detail into Ms Buxley's window each time the lawnmowing brings him around.

190.title: Lawnmowing
190.author: by Stephan Pastis.
190.series: May 25, 2007) "Do You Suppose Local News Makes More Sense If You're Lobotommized?"*
notes: Summary: The newscasters make a joke about rain and lawnmowing, then laugh for a whole panel.

191.title: Lawnmowing
191.author: by Scott Adams.
191.series: May 26, 2007) "Go to My House and Mow My Lawn So This Doesn't Become a Lopsided Relationship"*
notes: Summary: Dilbert will help, under certain conditions.

192.title: Lawnmowing
192.author: by Dean Young and John Marshall.
192.series: May 26, 2007) "Listen, If You Don't Want to Cut the Grass, Just Say So"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood is talking about gas prices, patriotic duty, and global warming.

193.title: Lawnmowing
193.author: by Ben Claassen III.
193.series: June 8, 2007) "Warning! There are Lesbians in This Comic"
notes: Summary: The lesbians shop, eat, brush their teeth, wear pants, do laundry, use computers, wash dishes, and mow the lawn.

194.title: Lawnmowing
194.author: Alex Graham Limited.
notes: Summary: Fred's master approaches an overgrown churchyard with his lawnmower.
An artist's signature seems to read: MOM.

195.title: Lawnmowing
195.author: by Greg & Brian Walker.
195.series: July 21, 2007) "Dad Doesn't Understand the Fine Art of Negotiation"*
notes: Summary: Chip tries to get his dad to pay him what a lawn service would charge.
Art signed: Browne.

196.title: Lawnmowing
notes: Arranged chronologically
